snippet: The Supreme Court on June 4, 2012, unanimously ruled against a protestor who said his free speech rights had been violated when Secret Service agents arrested him after he made critical remarks about the Bush administration’s war policies.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court on June 4, 2012, unanimously ruled against a protestor who said his free speech rights had been violated when Secret Service agents arrested him after he made critical remarks about the Bush administration’s war policies.

headline.main: Supreme Court Decision: Reichle v. Howards
